meanings.definition: To squeeze or crowd together tightly
meanings.sent1: The passengers had to scrouge together in the crowded bus during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: Please do not scrouge the toothpaste tube, as it may damage the product.
meanings.sent3: Trying to scrouge all your clothes into a small suitcase is like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The tight deadline scrouged all the team members to work together efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The hug from the children scrouged all the love and warmth in the room.

meanings.sent1: The dictator would scrouge anyone who dared to speak against him.
meanings.sent2: The cruel supervisor would scrouge the employees with unreasonable demands.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher did not scrouge the students out of malice, but to push them to excel.
meanings.sent4: The storm scrouged the small town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The bully's words scrouged the confidence of the young student.

meanings.sent2: My uncle is known as the family scrouge because he never buys gifts.
meanings.sent3: The scrouge at the office always takes more than his fair share of snacks.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the scrouge learned the value of generosity and kindness.
